basics.name: Chinedum Ukejianya
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Chinedum holds a Bachelors Degree in Physical Science with a concentration in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science. Though Chinedum spent a measurable amount of time programming through Role Playing Game Maker 2003, a gaming software tool, his first true introduction to computer science was through a Hack-a-thon. From that point on, Chinedum has enjoyed problem solving various programming obstacles and creating mini side projects.

highlights: Worked with GraphQL and Ruby on Rails to migrate a database from Google Cloud Datastore
Worked with Java, Maven, and Google Cloud Platform to service more than 30,000 people simantaneously on both a web and mobile apps
Improved and refactor a integration PHP codebase connected to the Iterable.com API
Helped greenfield a new project using AngularJS 9 and Ngrx
Architeched and built an Admin Service for both BE and FE using Python, AWS Lambda Functions, Angular 11, MongoDB, and Auth0 API
Helped transition our backend into our new stack which consisted of Graphql, nodejs, trypescript, AWS CDK, and postgress

work.summary: SocialCode enables smarter, more profitable brands. Our media and analytics capabilities empower marketers to understand, manage and reach their audiences across social, mobile and video platforms.
highlights: Worked with Django and python 2.7/3.5 on the backend to interact with the pinterest and snapchat social media ads api
Made the activation app faster and more responsive by transitioning our BackboneJS components to EmberJS
Deployed and worked on multiple micro-services using Agile Methods and technologies such as chef, jenkins, aws (RDS and EC2), sentry, and git
Helped shaped Snapchats and Pinterest Ad APIs by testing the APIs, documenting inconsistencies, and sharing my findinds with the respective social media's developer ad teams
Led projects that added features to our activation app which created an increase in productivity with our internal Ad Managers Sales Team

work.summary: A news reader app that aims to build on the understanding of how people consume news, giving users stories picked by other people who share their interests.
highlights: Converted a bookmarklet into a google chrome extension
Helped to incorporate NPR podcasts in "troves" during a in house hack-a-thon
Worked primarily with Python, Pyramid (ORM), and Mako.

education.area: Physical Science [concentration in Mathematics, Physics, and Computer Science]
